pr_title: Use namespace for attributes put into user classes

timeline.message: Use namespace for attributes put into user classes

timeline.bodyText: removed TODO because I checked and this attribute is being used to pass Span and call end on it, no need to pass Context
timeline.author: trask

timeline.bodyText: Should this use class as well?
timeline.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: done, this required adding a dependency on the netty instrumentation, which seems reasonable
replies.author: trask

timeline.bodyText: For Netty 4.1, maybe we can just use it's native AttributeKey.valueOf(Class<?>, String)
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText:
👍 I will send shortly in a follow-up PR, I think I've convinced myself we can remove the logic below at the same time, but want to propose in a separate PR for visibility

  
    
      opentelemetry-java-instrumentation/instrumentation/netty/netty-4.1/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/javaagent/instrumentation/netty/v4_1/AttributeKeys.java
    
    
        Lines 47 to 53
      in
      889bce0
    
    
    
    

        
          
             /** 
        

        
          
              * Generate an attribute key or reuse the one existing in the global app map. This implementation 
        

        
          
              * creates attributes only once even if the current class is loaded by several class loaders and 
        

        
          
              * prevents an issue with Apache Atlas project were this class loaded by multiple class loaders, 
        

        
          
              * while the Attribute class is loaded by a third class loader and used internally for the 
        

        
          
              * cassandra driver. 
        

        
          
              */
replies.author: trask
